text: The 1st edition of the Prix Versailles recognized four projects located in France. The awards were conferred at UNESCO Headquarters on 19 June 2015. == Judges == {| class="wikitable" style="text-align: center; width: 100%;" |- ! width="33%" | Name || width="34%" | Position || width="33%" | Nationality |- | Paul Andreu || Architect || France |- | Gilles Lipovetsky || Philosopher || France |- | Thom Mayne || Architect || United States |- | François de Mazières (chairman of the judges panel) || Mayor of Versailles || France |- | Anne- Sophie Pic || Chef || France |- | Minja Yang || former Deputy Director of the World Heritage Center || Japan |} == Winners == {| class="wikitable" style="text-align: center; width: 100%;" ! width="10%" | Prix or special prize || width="10%" | Category || width="22%" | Project || width="16%" | Location || width="10%" | Country || width="22%" | Architect or designer || width="10%" | Country |- | Prix Versailles | | Galeries Lafayette, Centre Bourse | Marseille | France | Moatti - Rivière | France |- | Special prize Interior | | Brasserie Les Haras | Strasbourg | France | Jouin Manku | France |- | Special prize Exterior | | Repetto shop, rue de Charonne | Paris | France | | |- | Special prize Services | | Musée des Confluences shop | Lyon | France | Julien Kolmont de Rogier | France |} == Notes and references == == See also == * 2015 in architecture == External links == * 2015 Category:2015 awards
title: Prix Versailles 2015
